epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_code: NSW - Mid North Coast - ECOPact - NE322L290
product_description.product_type: NE322L290 S32/20/120 Concrete ECOPact General use concrete
product_description.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
product_description.product_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Used for foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, and other infrastructure.

concrete_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
concrete_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects with high strength, durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural finishes, and decorative applications.

hazardous_substances.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: End-of-life fate controlled by others; assumptions based on common scenarios and National Waste Report 2022

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) not included in EPD results; recommended to consider in whole-of-life studies per BS EN 16757:2017

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

impact_categories: Use of renewable primary energy excluding raw materials
Use of non-renewable primary energy excluding raw materials
Additional Green Star indicators (HTc, HTnc, LU, IR, PM, WSI)
disclaimers: Some impact indicators have high uncertainties or limited experience
Ionising radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Scientific articles on carbon footprint of Australia's construction sector
additional_info.disclaimer: This publication provides general information only and is no substitute for professional technical engineering advice. Holcim accepts no liability for any loss or damage resulting from reliance on this information.
